attributes.action: Set up a National Register for carers  and Health Care Assistants
attributes.background: Families need to feel safe in the knowledge that carers who carry out work with the utmost trust need to belong on a national register.

attributes.action: Issue British passports without the EU logo.
attributes.background: As the British people voted to leave the EU on 23 June 2016 and will be entirely out by March 2019, stop issuing British passports with the EU logo immediately and give people the option to exchange a passport with an EU logo for one without an EU logo, for a small fee.

attributes.action: Make it the law for all schools to display their Anti Bullying Policy!
attributes.background:
A recent study has seen that 80% of teens were not aware their school had an anti-bullying policy. 
100% said they felt it would benefit if the policy was displayed on notice boards around the school. So let’s make it the law to have it displayed and not just on a website!!
attributes.additional_details:
This study was conducted on Chat2HelpAllTeenagers.co.uk from 30 teenagers across the UK. 
Why aren’t schools making all parents and children aware of the policy - as the government website indicates all parents and children should be told about it. 
This recent study highlights that this is not done, and feel we need to change this! 
 
So please help, sign this petition 
 
www.chat2helpallteenagers.co.uk

attributes.action: Send out a booklet to every household in the UK about leaving the EU
attributes.background: The government spent £9 million of taxpayers money informing the public they wanted to remain in the EU and why. The people rejected the governments view and gave an instruction to leave the EU  . The government must now spend an equal amount on a Brexit booklet explaining the advantages of Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
The public are being bombarded with scaremongering from the media and politicians of the damage Brexit will cause to our country.
It is time for the government to provide a booklet promoting the positives of being an independent nation again and set out its vision of the future for our trade, workers and civil rights, security and the revival of our fishing fleets. 

The government must act fairly and provide a Brexit booklet on the advantages of leaving the single market and customs union

attributes.action: Lower the Voting age to 16
attributes.background:
At 16, UK citizens can do the following:
Get married with consent
Can own property
Can get a job
Can join the army
Pay taxes
Join a trade union
Many 16 year-olds feel that as they contribute to society and the country, they deserve their voices heard as to its political direction and leader.

attributes.action: Constitution to prevent ceding sovereignty to foreign powers without referendum
attributes.background:
In signing the European Communities Bill in 1972 thus taking us into the EEC without our consent, Edward Heath sacrificed our independence. Thus making the articles on the supremacy of British Parliament only of historical perspective.
He should've had referendum 1st on such constitutional change
attributes.additional_details:
In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change. 
We need a constitution that is not merely convention, but that is actually written into our law to prevent this happening again.

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Dental Hygiene in pregnancy’ booklets to 12 week antenatal checkups
attributes.background:
I feel like we are being let down in terms of proactive dental hygiene education for pregnant women.
 I believe thousands of women are having to undergo dental work postpartum as they were not aware of the significant affect that changes in hormones during pregnancy can have on their teeth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am aware that the NHS provides free dental care to pregnant women & for up to one year post partum but I feel that more should be done proactively in order to stop new mums having to go through painful/intrusive dental treatment. 

Advice regarding additional brushing after certain foods, not brushing immediately after bouts of morning sickness, additional visits to the hygienist, increasing calcium & vitamin D 

Ensuring that both midwives & dentists educate pregnant women of additional risks

attributes.action: To increase the speed limit on UK motorways to 85 miles per hour.
attributes.background: Many of us drive at around 80 miles per hour on the motorway. It is common to be overtaken by vehicles travelling at much higher speeds. It appears we are all breaking the law: yet only a few of us are caught over-speeding, prosecuted, fined and criminalized; this undermines the law.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics indicated that almost 50% of vehicles exceeded the speed limit in 2011 on the motorways. Modern vehicles with superior braking systems and a whole raft of safety systems can travel at much higher speeds comfortably. The European Transport Safety Council found that most vehicle accidents in 27 European countries occur on rural and urban roads: not on Motorways. The low UK speed limit on motorways may be responsible for congestion by preventing ‘free flow’ of traffic.

attributes.action: Enact an Environmental Law
attributes.background: Since the BBC 1 broadcasting of the Blue Planet (Oceans) showing the harm caused to marine life by plastic packaging there has been a public outcry.
attributes.additional_details:
Supermarket chains should be compelled (by law) to publish on their web sites their use of three categories of plastic packaging.

1) Single Use Plastic 
2) Recyclable Plastic 
3) 100% biodegradable plastic 

And all as a percentage of their total plastic packaging. - Doing this would enable consumers to make choices as to where they shop, and what purchases they make not just on price but additionally and importantly on environmental sustainability.

attributes.action: Revoke the Amendment to the Double Taxation Agreement (Article 18)  March 2018.
attributes.background:
We were in the Royal Air Force for just under 30 years.  We had met and holidayed in Cyprus towards the latter part of our service.
We decided that we would like to remain in Cyprus after our years were up.
The amended DTA would reduce the amount of household income Veterans' have to live on.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed amendment to the DTA, signed by both Governments in March 2018 (and yet to be passed by either parliament), proposes that from next year, Civil Service and Military Pensions will be taxed at source (the U.K.) and not as the majority of us arranged, when we decided to live and contribute here in Cyprus.

All we ask is that we can continue to live and contribute here with the same agreements in place from 1960, and even with Cyprus joining the E.U. in 2004.

attributes.action: Provide domestic violence victims with paid leave to help them escape abusers
attributes.background: An average of 2 women a week are killed in the UK. The majority are killed at home, often at the hands of a partner. One of the most dangerous times for a victim of domestic abuse is when they try to leave. In giving victims help with their economic situation, we could save so many.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside a threat of violence, emotional & financial barriers make leaving an abusive home difficult. Escaping requires meticulous planning and preparation. Someone may need time off work to move without their partner knowing or they may simply not be able to afford to escape. 

If the UK follows the example set by New Zealand and the Philippines, in giving domestic violence victims paid leave to escape their violent household, we could help before it's too late. 

https://www.google.co.nz/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/world/2018/jul/26/new-zealand-paid-domestic-violence-leave-jan-logie

attributes.action: Stop NHS sharing data with 3rd-party advertisers, analytics and social media
attributes.background: When you use NHS websites, you get tracked. The issue was raised in 2010 by MPs, but was not resolved. Instead, Facebook and other companies went on to get data for a further 7 years. NHS privacy policies say that there's tracking. Such 3rd parties should be barred from NHS websites and mobile apps.
attributes.additional_details: The combination of HTTP Referers, third party cookies and third party JavaScript, provide these parties with the ability to track users by their unique or user ids and identify pages visited. Furthermore, third party JavaScript allows them to change NHS page content as they see fit, access data on it or act as the user on pages. I've complained directly to the NHS, ICO and Ministers in the hope of getting this fixed, but it is still a serious problem.

attributes.action: Increase the Defence Budget to 3% of the GDP (Approx. £80bn/year) by 2025.
attributes.background:
Defence is an important subject.
The Armed Forces require a lot of money to be put towards them, as having the most professional military on the planet isn't cheap.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent budget cuts have had a severe effect on our Armed Forces. Thousands of jobs have been lost, and not enough people are joining.

Our Navy is ever decreasing in size, with barely enough ships to protect the new Queen Elizabeth class carriers, or even men to crew them.
Our Air Force lacks in the modern aircraft we need to defend our great nation.
The Army is in need of new land-systems all the time.

Our current Defence Budget just cannot afford it, especially how it's currently decreasing.

attributes.action: Make primary schools exempt from ancient heraldry laws.
attributes.background: The Lord Lyon King of Arms act 1672 is an outdated law requiring registration of coats of arms. Schools which have used logos for years which unknowingly contravened these laws are being asked to pay the £1800 registration fee which could be better used for resources and services to aid education.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thecourier.co.uk/fp/news/local/perth-kinross/655625/perth-pupils-told-to-raise-almost-2000-for-school-crest-following-legal-dispute/

The 300 year old law is unnecessary for primary schools and parents and teachers are facing the difficult decision to either change the logo or pay the fee through fundraising. Both outcomes resulting in cost implications and a waste of money, time and resources. Small schools should be made exempt.

attributes.action: Ban cold calling at people’s homes
attributes.background: A neighbour was brutally attacked and murdered in her own home after answering the door to her assailant. It’s common knowledge that conmen use cold calling to steal from vulnerable people and gain access to homes often leading to devastating consequences.
attributes.additional_details: People should not be allowed to sell goods or services door-to-door without an invitation. We need to ban cold calling to protect the elderly and vulnerable by cutting off access for the cruel people that use this as a means of access. Most people now will go online to source builders, windows etc and look for reviews of companies. We do not need people knocking on our homes leaving some scared and open to being subjecting to robberies, fraud and being harmed.

attributes.action:
Introduce a national day called 
National Ability Day.
attributes.background: People with disabilities are often overlooked, having a National Ability Day will show the country what people with disabilities can do than what we can’t.

attributes.action: Investigate the destruction of Windrush records by the Home Office.
attributes.background:
The Home office said that these documents were disposed of under the Data Protection Act. The result has been thousands of people effectively being made stateless and some being deported. 
There are reports of what happened and of staff raising concerns at the time and being overruled.
attributes.additional_details:
The Windrush generation like millions of immigrants from around the world brought their families here, settled and made a massive contribution to British life. 
 
This government appears to have set out to strip them of their rights by changing the law without debate and disposing of the records. 
 
Shredding historical records that effectively remove rights from British citizens is an appalling abuse of power. 
 
It must be investigated!

attributes.action: QTS for Indian teachers.
attributes.background: Bachelor of Education degree (B.Ed.) must be recognised as QTS ( Qualified teacher status) in UK. In the same way as teaching degrees from EEA, US, Australia & New Zealand are recognised.
attributes.additional_details: The Indian education system has produced doctors, engineers and qualified professionals, working around the world. Ironic, that our teachers cannot work with their degree in UK, but can vote here!

attributes.action: To prohibit the sale of rat poison to non-professionals
attributes.background: People are baiting dog treats and or leaving large quantities of it in parks and open spaces to kill off animals. I have had one dog recently die and another even more recently digest a large quantity and is lucky to be alive. Luckily we rushed him straight to the vets and he is now home safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theargus.co.uk/news/16860293.family-devastated-as-rat-poison-kills-one-dog-and-almost-kills-another/

attributes.action: Provide more support to put an end to modern slavery in Libya
attributes.background: Last year CNN released video footage of Black African migrants being bought and sold in to slavery in Libya. The horrific events happened openly in slave auctions and migrants were being sold for as little as $400. There were also many accounts that women and girls were being sold in to sex slavery.
attributes.additional_details:
It has now been almost a year since the release of the slave auction video footage. The media's interest has significantly lessened, and public discussion has waned.

I am therefore asking the UK government to again put pressure on Libya to put an end to modern-day slavery. I am also asking the UK government to provide the public with a full and transparent update on the UK emergency interventions and UK programmes designed to specifically target Black African migrants and refugees in Libya, including a response containing details of further plans to support the complete eradication of modern slavery in the region.

https://edition.cnn.com/2017/11/14/africa/libya-migrant-auctions/index.html

attributes.action: Install ‘donation stations’ at a&e/hospital entrances/exits for people to use
attributes.background:
The NHS provide an amazing service, yet are always getting budget cuts. 

Install machines at hospital entrances and exits in which people can leave a donation if they wish, cash or card (contactless).

Use this to top up the NHS budget as a whole, or let hospitals use how they need to.
attributes.additional_details: Many people leave hospital thinking how can I thank the NHS for their help. I certainly have on our several a&e visits over the last few years. Installing a donation station would help people to feel they are giving thanks whilst helping our NHS through the tough cuts they face. The cost of installing would of course be covered in no time with donations received then start generating profit for the NHS.

attributes.action: Stop providers of Buy to Let mortgages discriminating against benefits claimants
attributes.background: The housing crisis in the UK is being exacerbated by the main lenders for Buy to Let mortgages, including TSB, Santander, Virgin and NatWest, stating that landlords must not let their properties to housing benefit claimants. We call on the government to make this discriminatory practice illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 120,000 children are living in temporary homes according to the public accounts committee (01/05/2017 The Times)

The number of tenants in the private sector receiving state help has risen by 50 per cent to almost 1.5 million since the financial crisis as wages stagnate and rents rise (01/05/2017

The combination of economic pressures means more and more vulnerable tenants are being pushed out of the private rented sector (Sean Tompkins, Chief Executive of Rics bbc.co.uk 09/07/2017)

attributes.action: Referendum to join the EU on the 30th of March 2019
attributes.background:
The UK is leaving the EU on the 29th of March 2019. There will be no second referendum for leaving the EU. The applicant accepts this.

However, the applicant strongly believes that there should be a referendum for joining the EU again on the 30th of March 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
The 2016 referendum was overshadowed by misinformation from both sides, scaremongering and possibly foreign interference. 

The voters did not fully understand what the EU is or the impact on their lives and the UK as a whole. 

This petition is no attempt to change the fact that the UK is leaving the EU.

However, and in the name of democracy, the voters should enjoy a referendum to decide if the UK should join the EU again after the 29th of March 2019.

For Queen & Country,

attributes.action: Amend Representation of the Peoples act 1983 to include Social Media campaigns.
attributes.background: Where transparency and fairness within elections is said to be valued within western democracies and is enshrined in British law, social media is being used to undermine these principles and laws, meaning the current law is therefore clearly outdated and unfit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: S.110 of the Representation of the Peoples act 1983 states that "an imprint must be added to printed election material. The electoral commission's advice on social media surrounding imprint offences however is as follows; "With the increased use of social hi-tech media there are an increasing number of allegations being made in relation to electronic material; however there is no imprint requirement here. The Electoral Commission recommends that the imprint should be provided as good practice.”

attributes.action: Require free water bottle refilling stations across UK service stations
attributes.background: The price of bottled water is extortionate in service stations across the UK (in some places beer is cheaper). This means people are penalised for needing an essential fuel of life, and adds to the plastic waste issue epidemic.
attributes.additional_details: Water bottle refilling stations would help cut down our plastic waste, promote a healthier lifestyle, and cut out the unnecessarily high price for bottled water in service stations, all at a low cost to the tax payer. This could be paired with cardboard cups and recycling bins for those wishing to have a quick drink on the go.

attributes.action: Change the The Parliamentary Oath to an oath to the people and to uphold the law
attributes.background:
Change the The Parliamentary Oath to an oath to the people and to uphold the law instead of an oath to the Monarchy
The duty of an hon. Member is to represent their constituents in Parliament
Therefore an hon. Member should be able to make their oath to the people they represent. Not the Monarchy
attributes.additional_details: To recognise that the principal duty of hon. Members is to represent their constituents in Parliament; also recognise that some hon. Members would prefer to swear an oath of allegiance to their constituents and the nation rather than the Monarch; and therefore calls on the Leader of the House to bring forward legislative proposals to introduce an optional alternative Parliamentary oath allowing hon. Members to swear allegiance to their constituents and the nation and to pledge to uphold the law rather than one pledging personal allegiance to the serving Monarch

attributes.action: Give an alternate route for couples to reach the spouse visa income requirement
attributes.background:
Each year thousands of couples are kept apart due to the strict and unrealistic financial requirements that must be met in order to obtain a UK spouse visa. 

The current requirement is £18,600 per year, this is not a small amount to earn for one individual as 3rd party income is not considered.
attributes.additional_details: This petition proposes that the financial requirement stays at £18,600, however the UK sponsor must only earn £14,966 per year (full time minimum wage). The £14,966 can then be combined with the income of a direct family member to reach the £18,600. After entry to the UK, the alien spouse has 6 months to find a job where the couple can reach £18,600 per year. This allows the government limit to stay in place while having a much fairer system.

attributes.action: Require drivers aged 70 + to undergo an annual road safety check and eye exam.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers aged 70 and over should have to have annual safety assessment by a qualified driving instructor, and an eye examination by an optometrist, both of whom will submit a report to the DVLA to allow them to hold their license for the following twelve months.

attributes.action: Children to wear helmets when using a scooter
attributes.background: We need to protect our children heads when scooting. Pavements have uneven surfaces, so as not to single out any children,it should be law that all children should be made to wear helmets.It seems bizarre that there is not a law in place currently to protect our children from head injuries.
attributes.additional_details: Nearly every child has a scooter and they ride extremely fast,often with both feet on the scooter. We need to protect our children's heads. Pavements are notorious for trip hazards-tree roots, drain covers, cracked paving and when scooting at the speed they do, they don't have time to react or brake to prevent the scooter tipping and risking a head injury.  Bones and scrapes heal but a head injury is extremely dangerous and could be easily prevented by protecting the head using a helmet.

attributes.action: Urgent Review & Increased Funding of "The 5 Year Forward View for Mental Health"
attributes.background: We urgently need more specialist psychiatric hospitals, walk in clinics, community psychiatrists and nurses.More Day Centres & facilities for people with mental health issues but to get the service back where it should be, we need the funding, and proper funding, to enable this to happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Approx. 15.5M people suffer with a mental health problem in the UK, which is roughly 1 in 4 people. Current plans need reviewing and funding needs injecting urgently. Awareness, Funding & Resources are quickly needed. Waiting times are excessive and lives are being lost as a result of this terrible dilemma we are in. 

Mental Health cases have have increased, which in turn has lead to an increase in our already stretched Emergency Services to deal with problems more frequently. LET'S TALK

attributes.action: Increase firefighters pay!
attributes.background:
My dad is a firefighter and has been amongst the many heroes tackling the fires on the moors/winter hill.
There is such a positive response from the public recognising the gruelling work they do its just a shame their wages don't reflect this with their pay frozen & capped at 1% It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details:
Firefighters pay has been frozen and capped at 1% with inflation rising at around 3%. With their pension and national insurance contributions rising their wages have in effect dropped! 
These heroes risk their lives every day not only putting out fires but doing so much more than you could imagine and they deserve / need to have the cap lifted and their pay increased. Lets give something back to them and help get this changed!

attributes.action: Debate a national Long Service and Good Conduct medal for all NHS staff.
attributes.background: We do not recognise the contribution NHS staff make to our local communities and to the nation as a whole.  I feel medals should be awarded at 30 years and 50 years continuous unbroken service to all NHS staff who complete that amount of service.
attributes.additional_details: 30 year medal should be called the Long Service and Good conduct Medal and 50 years service should be called the Meritorious Service Medal.  Unbroken service should include Maternity leave, sick leave and bank staff and part time staff.  The medal should say " From a grateful nation" on it.  Ribbon colours and design should be put to NHS staff for their ideas.

attributes.action: Update the current legislation: "The Electricity at Work Regulations 1989"
attributes.background: There exists ambiguity within the electrical industry, specifically with regard to electrical installation of equipment, with what can be considered acceptable with regard to meeting the requirements of regulations, due to the outdated and generic criteria which is open to interpretation.
attributes.additional_details:
The EaWR 1989 would benefit from an update to specifically clarify and reference the associated standards and regulations detailed below:

The Electricity at Work Regulations 1989

The Electrical Equipment (Safety) Regulations 2016

BS 7671

BS 6423

This would ensure that persons on whom duties are imposed (e.g. duty holders) have a clear and defined defence against any alleged breaches.

attributes.action: Main parents household income to be calculated and used for child maintenance
attributes.background:
Aims to stop the main parent from using their child as a monetary weapon, as seen in many cases.
There are too many cases where, for example, the mother is living a more luxurious lifestyle and does not need extra monetary support for the child. But still claims from the father who is struggling

attributes.action: Improve access to healthcare for homeless people
attributes.background: Homeless people are dying far too early, and of preventable illnesses, in part due to problems accessing health care which could save their lives. The government should improve provisions for such people, who are impeded from getting care due to their circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: 50% of homeless people die of disease and infection, and a further 36% die from drugs and alcohol. These deaths could be prevented through improved access to healthcare. At present, the average age of death for homeless people is 45 years in men and 43 in women. This is unacceptable and must be improved.

attributes.action: Lower the rate of duty on alcoholic beverages in pubs (and restaurants?)
attributes.background: Pubs form a valuable social and community function in many towns and villages and help to make Britain what it is. Towns and villages with good pubs are better than those without. This should be recognised by Government. It is the role of good Government to make this country a better place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
Communal drinking and socialising forms a valuable function in terms of social cohesion and sense of community. Home drinking or street drinking can be actively detrimental to this. Making retail purchased alcohol relatively more expensive would, I believe, help to discourage this. The alternative of course would be raising the level of duty charged on alcoholic beverages bought from retail outlets.

Many thanks for your time.

attributes.action: Create an independent enquiry to determine if foreign powers influenced Brexit.
attributes.background: With allegations of Russian interference in elections in other countries and elements of the Leave campaign facing allegations of violating spending rules that may have influenced the narrow outcome of the referendum, citizens have a right to know if Brexit truly is the will of the British people.
attributes.additional_details: It's everywhere in respected media outlets as well as American intelligence reports.

attributes.action: Stop avoidable deaths: additional regulation of Diamorphine and other opiates
attributes.background:
Diamorphine should only be used for extreme pain in terminal illness. 
My husband was prescribed Diamorphine for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease and pneumonia from which he was recovering. This is wrongful prescribing and can cause death. Stricter legislation and rules are needed.
attributes.additional_details: Much stricter control on the prescribing of Diamorphine and all other opiates is needed. At least three doctors should authorise any prescription of these drugs, following open discussions with the patients and family. The wishes of the patient must be the central focus. Special training needs to be given in the prescription of opiates to doctors and pharmacists. Legislation needs to be introduced to enforce the above. Patients' safety must prevail.

attributes.action: Everyone must wear a helmet whilst riding their push bike or scooter by law
attributes.background:
It’s not acceptable that kids or adults ride their bikes or scooters without wearing helmets to protect them. 
If we can ride on roads we must be equipped to deal with road hazards
attributes.additional_details: Australia, New Zealand and America have laws that mean it is illegal to ride your bike of scooter without a helmet. The cost to the NHS if you sustain a brain injury as a result of not wearing a helmet is massive far more than the price of a helmet.

attributes.action: Ban fruit and veg being wrapped/packaged in plastic by 2020
attributes.background: The UK government want to eliminate all avoidable plastic waste by 2042, so why not start where its easy. Most fruit and veg don't need packaging at all.  It will be a great place to start to help eliminate all plastic waste which is harmful to the environment and all life, including people.
attributes.additional_details:
Goverments environment plan: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/25-year-environment-plan 

Information about plastic pollution: www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/science-environment-42264788

attributes.action: Tougher fines for Drivers that park in DISABLED SPACES
attributes.background: Disabled spaces are there for people that need them some of the most disabled and vulnerable people in our community, People get fined the same amount for parking in a space and over staying there paid parking ticket they have bought from a machine.
attributes.additional_details: People who park in a disabled space without a blue badge show total disregard for the people who need them the most, the punishment should be harsher why should they pay the same as someone over staying there paid ticket?

attributes.action: Better health care and awareness for young people with respiratory conditions.
attributes.background: As a young person who suffers from severe Asthma, I've only recently started getting the medical treatment i needed after a lifetime of suffering from the condition (17 years). Unfortunately this is the same for many young people and this is something i would like to change.
attributes.additional_details: In my opinion, GP's are not educated enough about the severity of asthma and other respiratory conditions such as COPD. Hospital treatments are only temporary such as nebulisers and steroid medication and after this, GP's do not provide the sufficient checks to make sure an "attack" does not happen again. Asthma UK and COPD both do fundraising to raise awareness of the severity of both conditions and I feel like the government and the public could do more to help.

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Dog to be recognised as an Assistance Dog
attributes.background: I have mental health problems, anxiety and depression. My dog helps me get out; keeps me calm in town when it's crowded and stops me acting on suicidal thoughts. My dog has given me a reason to get out of bed. Surely this will also help the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: I have also spoken to other people with mental health and found their dogs have been a huge help to them.”

attributes.action: Public Inquiry into the actions of South Yorkshire Police at Orgreave 1984
attributes.background: At Orgreave, South Yorkshire Police ordered officers to charge "a largely peaceful crowd" & evidence given by South Yorkshire Police (SYP) has been described as "the biggest frame-up ever", SYP had a culture of fabricating evidence, which was not corrected by the time of the Hillsborough disaster.

attributes.action: Stop Proceeds of Crime Act powers from being used in planning cases
attributes.background: Change the law to stop local authorities using powers in the Proceeds of Crime Act in planning cases. The POCA was intended to be used to seize assets of drug dealers, arms dealers etc - serious criminals. Local authorities must be prevented from using it against people for breaching planning laws.
attributes.additional_details: My family are a farming family. Due to an alleged planning infraction and an enforcement order that escalated, the powers in the Proceeds of Crime Act can be used take assets that my family has worked for all of our lives. For our assets (up to and including the family home) to be called a 'proceed of crime' is unjust, immoral and deeply unfair.

attributes.action: Stop all animal testing in the UK
attributes.background: Animals are dying from animal testing and it isn’t fair on them as they have lives that they should be able to live

attributes.action: Introduce work-based subjects and practical skills into the schools in the UK.
attributes.background: Many children and are choosing to live a life surrounded by the streets, drugs, and murders. This stems from poor education, the education system in the UK is outdated and boring. There needs to be a change to help children, give them confidence and knowledge of work skills.
attributes.additional_details: Why are children still having to learn about the history of the Victorian times and write tons of uninteresting and difficult paperwork, when they could be learning skills of the trade? Maybe they want to be an electrician, which involves mathematical and practical skills. Introducing work-based subjects or practical skills into secondary schools will keep them interested and willing to learn rather than misbehave or drop out of school. An education system they are interested in will give them the knowledge and the confidence to leave secondary education knowing exactly what they are good at, exactly where they want to go after leaving school and are comfortable proceeding a lifelong career and keep them off the streets.

attributes.action: Make a paid counsellor available for all students in every secondary school
attributes.background: Adolescents aged 11-19 attend secondary school. Ages that bring their own personal, intimate difficulties and ups & downs. They are finding it harder mental health problems. There are many more school nurses on site than counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Figures suggest 20% of adolescents may experience a mental health problem in any given year, that 50% of mental health problems are established by age 14 with 75% established by age 24. In 2004 10% of children and young people aged 5-16 years had a clinically diagnosable mental health problem; yet in 2008 one study suggested 70% of children & adolescents who experienced mental health problems had not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. It is thought 13% of adolescents try to self harm between ages 11-16. Figures in 2014 suggested a 70% increase in A&E admissions for self-harm over the previous two years.

attributes.action: Ban TV adverts of  gambling sites and betting firms sponsoring football shirts.
attributes.background:
Gambling addictions are costing the country £1.2bn.
The increasing relationship between football and gambling is normalising gambling  and influencing our vulnerable children and young people. 24/7 access to online betting via smart phones will soon cause a national epidemic. It needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Although not involving a chemical like an addiction to smoking, alcohol or drugs the problem or compulsive gambler is just as much an  addict. They will have financial and relationship problems. They could end up in prison or even committing suicide - suggested rates being 20%.
In 1965 the British Government banned tobacco advertising and in 2005 banned sponsorship of global events.
They need to do the same with gambling and betting firm sponsorships before more lives are ruined.

attributes.action: Ban quad bikes in residential areas
attributes.background: Loud and aggressively speeding quadbikes are everywhere in residential areas morning evening nights. They so loud that my 4 months old son is terrified of them. It’s very normal to see a quadbike speeding 40-50 mph in 20-30 mph zone.
attributes.additional_details:
These quadbike riders do not have any respect for speed limits. 
No respect if someone is ill at home needs rest. 
So loud that little babies waking up screaming. 
And above all safety of our kids on the roads just outside your home.
